author: Peerzada Ashiq
text:
Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) president Mehbooba Mufti on Sunday dropped hints on continuing with her party’s alliance with the BJP, saying “if we shake hands with any power in New Delhi, then Jammu and Kashmir should get a sense of empowerment too.”

Partners come closer

Without putting any timeline on government formation, Ms. Mufti said, “If his [late PDP patron Mufti Muhammad Sayeed] mission, vision and agenda are taken forward, the government formation will take no time.”

The two coalition partners, the BJP and the PDP, are reportedly inching closer through backchannel talks to form the government.

“My father made a sacrifice [by joining hands with the BJP] but he would not have taken a U-turn like [National Conference founder] Sheikh Mohammad Abdullah in the past. I have faith in my father’s decision… but I will safeguard the interests of J&K as well as of the country,” Ms. Mufti said. Terming “people her strength”, Ms. Mufti said J&K had to act as “a bridge between India and Pakistan” and the “mistrust between New Delhi and Srinagar should go.”

“The decision of Prime Minister [Narendra] Modi to visit Lahore made my father very happy in the hospital. He said ‘he [Modi] could make powerful people understand the importance of engaging with Pakistan’,” she added.

Reaching out to the separatist constituency, Ms. Mufti said she was “pained to see mothers whose sons with B.A. and M.A. degrees die in encounters.”
title: Have faith in my father’s decision: Mehbooba
